data.title: Deans and Faculty of University - Woxsen University
data.meta_description: Our Faculty is a judious mix of leading academicians, industry experts & entrepreneurs from across the world, who provide mentorship through the various stages of learning, bringing with them best of knowledge applicable to both the Indian and global contexts.
data.text:
Education:

Ph.D. in International Education and Linguistics

Specialisation:

International Education, Applied Linguistics, International Law, International Politics

Research:

Comparative Literature in Cinematic Application; Art Appreciation in Literature, Media, and Film; Multilingualism in Science, Literature, and Film; Educational and Feminist Inspirations in Movies; International Education and Applied Linguistics; Cross-Cultural Communication and Competence; Cosmopolitanism and Personal Cultural Identity; Cultural and Macroeconomic Aspects of Tourism; Slow and Sustainable Global Travel and Tourism

Courses Taught:

Master’s Level: Culture Diplomacy, Comparative Politics, World History, Intercultural Communication, Communication and Diplomacy, Introduction to Sociology, Introduction to International Relations, Theory of International Relations, Ethics and International Affairs, Environment and Climate Change, Politics of Sustainable Energy, Global Business.

Bachelor’s Level: Intercultural Communication, Tolerance and Diversity, Mass Communication Theory and Research, Public Opinion and Propaganda, Organizational Communication, Organizational Behavior, Negotiation and Conflict, Writing for Diplomacy, Public Speaking, Introduction to Political Science, Media Ethics, Business Ethics and Corporate Governance, Global Governance and Social Responsibility, Ethical Studies, International Studies.

Publications:

27 publications address cosmopolitanism, internationalism or international education.

26 publications on art, literature, poetry, film, movies or Romanticism.

20 publications on multilingualism or language learning.

18 publications on sustainable tourism.

4 publications in macroeconomics.3 short stories that had received awards at creative writing competitions

1. Women behind wheels exploring the clay pottery from thiruchigadi, nilgiris, tamil nāduwomen behind wheels exploring the clay pottery from thiruchigadi, nilgiris, tamil nādu

ShodhKosh: Journal of Visual and Performing Arts

(The research shows these women's strong sense of individuality, strong spirit, added contribution to the cultural skillset and a contribution towards retaining a thriving craft legacy by examining the socioeconomic dynamics and obstacles they encounter.)

2. Therapeutic Yogic Techniques for Improving Sleep Quality Among YouthTherapeutic Yogic Techniques for Improving Sleep Quality Among Youth

International Journal Of Novel Research And Development

(This research “Therapeutic Yogic Techniques for Improving Sleep Quality Among Youth” studies the facts and details of why sleep matters within this particular age group, how it effects on longer term health consequences and also discusses the yogic practices that can be incorporated in daily lives to reduce these consequences and improve sleep cycle of younger masses. )

3. Illustrated Samadhi Pada - The Science of Unlearning

Devotees of Sri Sri Ravi Shankar Ashram (Art of Living Foundation)

( Yoga is commonplace, Yogis are rare. Patanjali Yoga Sutras, which reveal the path of Ashtanga Yoga, is the most authoritative text on the science of Yoga. It has 4 sections, of which the first is SAMADHI PADA. Samadhi means meditation. When the commentary absorbed by the intellect is coupled with sitting silently in Meditation, the Chitta and Self are illumined, and lost lasting peace and love can get established in life. This book is an illustrated exposition of the enlightening verses of SAMADHI PADA. From the very profound journal of Yoga Darshana – Yoga Sutras of Patanjali). The text includes original Sanskrit sutras with a Latin transliteration and in-depth English commentary.)
